com.samskivert.jdbc
Interface DatabaseLiaison

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseLiaison, DefaultLiaison, HsqldbLiaison, MySQLLiaison, PostgreSQLLiaison
public interface DatabaseLiaison

Despite good intentions, JDBC and SQL do not provide a unified interface to all databases. There remain idiosyncrasies that must be worked around when making code interact with different database servers. The database liaison encapsulates the code needed to straighten out the curves and curve out the straights.

Method Detail

matchesURL

boolean matchesURL(String url)
Indicates whether or not this database liaison is the proper liaison for the specified database URL.

Returns:
true if we should use this liaison for connections created with the supplied URL, false if we should not.

isDuplicateRowException

boolean isDuplicateRowException(SQLException sqe)
Determines whether or not the supplied SQL exception was caused by a duplicate row being inserted into a table with a unique key.

Returns:
true if the exception was caused by the insertion of a duplicate row, false if not.

isTransientException

boolean isTransientException(SQLException sqe)
Determines whether or not the supplied SQL exception is a transient failure, meaning one that is not related to the SQL being executed, but instead to the environment at the time of execution, like the connection to the database having been lost.

Returns:
true if the exception was thrown due to a transient failure, false if not.

lastInsertedId

int lastInsertedId(Connection conn,
                   String table,
                   String column)
                   throws SQLException
Attempts as dialect-agnostic an interface as possible to the ability of certain databases to auto-generated numerical values for i.e. key columns; there is MySQL's AUTO_INCREMENT and PostgreSQL's DEFAULT nextval(sequence), for example.

Throws:
SQLException

createGenerator

void createGenerator(Connection conn,
                     String tableName,
                     String columnName,
                     int initialValue)
                     throws SQLException
Initializes the column value auto-generator described in lastInsertedId(java.sql.Connection, java.lang.String, java.lang.String). This should be idempotent (meaning the generator may already exist in which case this method should have no negative effect like resetting it).

Throws:
SQLException

deleteGenerator

void deleteGenerator(Connection conn,
                     String tableName,
                     String columnName)
                     throws SQLException
Deletes the column value auto-generator described in lastInsertedId(java.sql.Connection, java.lang.String, java.lang.String).

Throws:
SQLException

dropColumn

boolean dropColumn(Connection conn,
                   String table,
                   String column)
                   throws SQLException
Drops the given column from the given table. Returns true or false if the database did or did not report a schema modification.

SQLException

                  boolean check)
                  throws SQLException
Adds a column to a table with the given definition. Tests for the previous existence of the column iff 'check' is true.

SQLException

addColumn

boolean addColumn(Connection conn,
                  String table,
                  String column,
                  ColumnDefinition columnDef,
                  boolean check)
                  throws SQLException
Adds a column to a table with the given definition. Tests for the previous existence of the column iff 'check' is true.

Throws:
SQLException

changeColumn

boolean changeColumn(Connection conn,
                     String table,
                     String column,
                     String type,
                     Boolean nullable,
                     Boolean unique,
                     String defaultValue)
                     throws SQLException
Alter the definition, but not the name, of a given column on a given table. Returns true or false if the database did or did not report a schema modification. Any of the nullable, unique and defaultValue arguments may be null, in which case the implementation will attempt to leave that aspect of the column unchanged.

Throws:
SQLException

renameColumn

boolean renameColumn(Connection conn,
                     String table,
                     String oldColumn,
                     String newColumn,
                     ColumnDefinition columnDef)
                     throws SQLException
Alter the name, but not the definition, of a given column on a given table. Returns true or false if the database did or did not report a schema modification.

Parameters:
columnDef - the full definition of the new column, including its new name (MySQL requires this for a column rename).
Throws:
SQLException

createTableIfMissing

boolean createTableIfMissing(Connection conn,
                             String table,
                             String[] columns,
                             ColumnDefinition[] declarations,
                             String[][] uniqueConstraintColumns,
                             String[] primaryKeyColumns)
                             throws SQLException
Created a new table of the given name with the given column names and column definitions; the given set of unique constraints (or null) and the given primary key columns (or null). Returns true if the table was successfully created, false if it already existed.

Throws:
SQLException

expandDefinition

String expandDefinition(ColumnDefinition coldef)
Create an SQL string that summarizes a column definition in that format generally accepted in table creation and column addition statements, e.g. INTEGER UNIQUE NOT NULL DEFAULT 100

tableContainsIndex

boolean tableContainsIndex(Connection conn,
                           String table,
                           String index)
                           throws SQLException
Returns true if the specified table exists and contains an index of the specified name; false if either conditions does not hold true. Note: the names are case sensitive.

Throws:
SQLException

tableContainsColumn

boolean tableContainsColumn(Connection conn,
                            String table,
                            String column)
                            throws SQLException
Returns true if the specified table exists and contains a column with the specified name; false if either condition does not hold true. Note: the names are case sensitive.

Throws:
SQLException

tableExists

boolean tableExists(Connection conn,
                    String name)
                    throws SQLException
Returns true if the table with the specified name exists, false if it does not. Note: the table name is case sensitive.

Throws:
SQLException

dropTable

boolean dropTable(Connection conn,
                  String name)
                  throws SQLException
Drops the given table and returns true if the table exists, else returns false. Note: the table name is case sensitive.

Throws:
SQLException

tableSQL

String tableSQL(String table)
Returns the proper SQL to identify a table. Some databases require table names to be quoted.

columnSQL

String columnSQL(String column)
Returns the proper SQL to identify a column. Some databases require columns names to be quoted.

indexSQL

String indexSQL(String index)
Returns the proper SQL to identify an index. Some databases require index names to be quoted.
